title: Zero matrix
summary: In mathematics, particularly linear algebra, a zero matrix or null matrix is a matrix all of whose entries are zero. It also serves as the additive identity of the additive group of m Ã— n {\displaystyle m\times n} matrices, and is denoted by the symbol O {\displaystyle O} or 0 {\displaystyle 0} followed by subscripts corresponding to the dimension of the matrix as the context sees fit.[1][2][3] Some examples of zero matrices are
